main event: An observer in Brooklyn sighted a bright object resembling a star moving across the sky on November 14, 1964.
interesting points: The object had speed and flight characteristics similar to a meteor,The sighting lasted only 2-3 seconds,The object appeared to originate near the star Betelgeuse in the constellation Orion,It was described as bluish white and of approximately 1st magnitude brightness,The observer eliminated several possibilities including balloon, airplane, and meteor.
sighted object: a bright object resembling a star
witness description: The observer has a good knowledge of astronomy.
